de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Tooltip

  • java.lang.Object
    • PopupPanel
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.Tooltip

  • public class Tooltip
extends PopupPanel
    A "tool tip" widget.

    A tool tip widget pops up a small yellow tool tip window if the user leaves the mouse still over a widget to which the tool tip is attached. This works only with widgets that source mouse events.

    Optionally, a limit can be set to how many times the tool tip may appear. The purpose is to avoid menacing the user with constant re-appearances of the tool tip.

    • Method Detail

      • addToWidget

        public static void addToWidget(Tooltip t,
               Widget w)
        Adds a tool-tip to a widget. The widget must have MouseOut and MouseOver handlers. It is recommended that it also has MouseMove, -Up and -Down handlers.

        Typical coding pattern:

        Tooltip.addToWidget(new Tooltip("tip"), anyWidget)

        Parameters:
        t - the tool-tip that shall be added
        w - the widget to which the tool-tip shall be added
